ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a lɔɔn ńgẅiin ntsaŋ, ńdɔg ńgʉa páʼ mé ge ŋag, mbà mé ge gɔɔn né nyìŋ gẅie à kaa nò fʉa ngie aa tefʉ̀a, é piŋ gɔɔn né nyìŋ gẅie à fʉ̌a, ngie aa ngàŋ mefʉa.
en: “If there is a dispute between men, they are to go to court, and the judges will hear their case. They will clear the innocent and condemn the guilty.

ngiemboon: Ńgwɔ́ gie mmó gie ngàŋ mefʉa fʉ̌a, á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé cúɔ yé cǔɔ, mbà nyìŋ gẅie à ŋaga ntsaŋ à ge tsẅi, à tʉ́ŋe ńnuŋe ssé mvfò yé. Mé cʉ́ʼʉ lécúɔ yé, ńcúɔ yé menzẅìŋ tsemé mmó mie é kuʼu na nò gie à fʉ̌ʼ.
en: If the guilty party deserves to be flogged, the judge will make him lie down and be flogged in his presence with the number of lashes appropriate for his crime.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ mé le ké ńcúɔ yé, tà é tɔ́gɔ tsemé mmó móm lekùɔ wɔ́. Ńtí nue mé lɔɔn ńcúɔ yé tà é tɔ́g púʼu, mbà mé cʉ̌ŋ nzẅìŋ wé, mvfò láʼ.
en: He may be flogged with forty lashes, but no more. Otherwise, if he is flogged with more lashes than these, your brother will be degraded in your sight.

ngiemboon: Pi pɔ́ɔn lékwɛ́ ncwò fòŋ gẅie à ne ńgiŋe na ngesáŋ ntsíŋ, ńdɔgɔ ḿbúʼu.
en: “Do not muzzle an ox while it treads out grain.

ngiemboon: Mbàŋa lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mefɛ̌, ńtsẅé tàʼ mbʉ̀a, atsɔ̌ tàʼ nyìŋ na pɔ́b piŋ ńkwé té gwɔ́ gie pɔ́ nzwě we gẅǐin múɔ, mbà mpfɔ̌g te gẅiin légwáʼa tsìŋendá ndúm we, ńgʉa ńzɔ́ʼɔ nyìŋ ndyɛ̀ʼɛ wɔ́. Afɛ̌ ndúm we ge sɔgɔ yé, é faʼ mefàʼ mie fɛ̌ ndúm manzwě à gẅiin léfaʼa na yé.
en: “When brothers live on the same property   and one of them dies without a son, the wife of the dead man may not marry a stranger outside the family. Her brother-in-law is to take her as his wife, have sexual relations with her, and perform the duty of a brother-in-law for her.

ngiemboon: Manzwě ge lɔgɔ múɔ letwó wɔb yé wembàŋa, é tsẅii ndúm we gẅie à ka kwě. Tá à cʉa púʼu, lezíŋ sé lê láʼ ḿbyé tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ wɔ́.
en: The first son she bears will carry on the name of the dead brother, so his name will not be blotted out from Israel.

ngiemboon: Mámbàŋa lɔɔn ńdʉʼʉ lésɔgɔ mpfɔ̌g fɛ̌ we, mbà manzwě ge gʉa ncú tÿǒsoŋ, á jʉʼ gie melÿò ée wó, é gɔɔn ngie: «Afɛ̌ ndúm wɔ̀ɔn te ne ńkwoŋo légÿo, lezíŋ fɛ̌ we, e láʼa ńtsẅé ńgwɔ́ ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ wɔ́. Afɛ̌ ndúm wɔ̀ɔn te ne ńkwoŋo lésɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn mɔ́.»
en: But if the man doesn’t want to marry his sister-in-law, she is to go to the elders at the city gate   and say, ‘My brother-in-law refuses to preserve his brother’s name in Israel. He isn’t willing to perform the duty of a brother-in-law for me.’

ngiemboon: À lɔɔn ńgɔɔn púʼu, mbà melÿò tÿǒsoŋ ge tóŋo yé, pâ pɔ̌ shwóŋe. Ńgwɔ́ gie à lɔɔn ńtiŋ ndʉ̀ʼ, ńdʉʼʉ lélɔgɔ manzwě, ńgÿo nzwě we,
en: The elders of his city will summon him and speak with him. If he persists and says, ‘I don’t want to marry her,’

ngiemboon: mbà mpfɔ̌g fɛ̌ we ŋwɛ́, ge tó tà kúu lejʉ́ŋ yé, á mvfò melÿò, é sẅɛɛ kwò melɔ̌ɔn yé, é tsɔg metyé shÿó yé, é leen ké gɔɔn ngie: «Yɔɔn aa mmó gie mé gẅiin légÿo na mámbàŋa gẅie à lʉʼʉ́ lényɛte ndá fɛ̌ we.»
en: then his sister-in-law will go up to him in the sight of the elders, remove his sandal from his foot, and spit in his face. Then she will declare, ‘This is what is done to a man who will not build up his brother’s house.’

ngiemboon: Mé ge fó fʉʼó, é láʼa cʉ́ʼʉ tóŋo tsìŋendá wɛ̌ nyìŋ á ngwòŋ Ésàlayɛ lê tsìŋendá nyìŋ gẅie mé la sẅɛ melɔ̌ɔn mé.
en: And his family name in Israel will be ‘The house of the man whose sandal was removed.’

ngiemboon: Mámbàŋa pɔ́ wetsɔ̌ lɔɔn ńdáʼ ne ńcúɔ melàʼ, anzwě tsɔ̌ tàʼ na pɔ́b tó, ńgee ńtág nzèm ndúm we, ńtsege pwó, ńtɔ́ɔn mámbàŋa gẅie à ne ńcúɔ ndúm we na jʉʼʉ shʉ́ yé,
en: “If two men are fighting with each other, and the wife of one steps in to rescue her husband from the one striking him, and she puts out her hand and grabs his genitals,

ngiemboon: mbà pi gẅiin lézáʼa pwó wɛ̌ manzwě té tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe mé.
en: you are to cut off her hand. Do not show pity.

ngiemboon: Mé té gẅiin légʉa pɔ̀ɔn pi, ńgyá mefʉ̀ʼ ncʉ̂e ntí pʉ̀a wɔ́; é fʉ̀ʼ gie e fʉʼʉ mmó, á cʉ́e, pɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ gie e fʉʼʉ mmó, á zeŋe.
en: “Do not have differing weights in your bag, one heavy and one light.

ngiemboon: Mé té gẅiin légʉa ndá pi, ńgyá metúŋ lɔg fʉʼʉ mmó ntí pʉ̀a wɔ́; á túŋ gẅie mé lɔg fʉʼʉ mmó, á gyɔ́ɔn, pɔ́ túŋ gẅie mé lɔg fʉʼʉ mmó, á kɔ́g.
en: Do not have differing dry measures in your house, a larger and a smaller.

ngiemboon: Pi gẅiin légẅiin fʉ̀ʼ ncʉ̂e gie e fʉʼʉ mmó, á kẅɛ kwàʼ páʼ à ne ńzɛ́te. Ńgẅiin légẅiin túŋ lɔg fʉʼʉ mmó, gẅie mé lɔg fʉʼʉ mmó, á kẅɛ kwàʼ ndʉŋndʉŋ. Tá à cʉa púʼu, melyɛʼɛ́ láʼ mí, e kẅiʼi, á tsɛ̀ɛ ngwòŋ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a é Ssé gi, náa né pí.
en: You must have a full and honest weight, a full and honest dry measure, so that you may live long in the land the Lord your God is giving you.

ngiemboon: Nyìŋ gẅie à lɔgɔ́ fʉ̀te, é fʉʼʉ mmó, à lɔgɔ ńgÿo ntʉ̀ nò tepòŋ á mvfò Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi.
en: For everyone who does such things and acts unfairly is detestable to the Lord your God.

ngiemboon: Pi kímte mmó gie pʉ̀a Amalɛg la gÿo na pi, á fʉ̀ʼ gie pi laa mánzsè, é fóo né Egíbtò,
en: “Remember what the Amalekites did to you on the journey after you left Egypt.

ngiemboon: páʼ pɔ́ la záʼa gẅí mánzsè, ńdÿɔ́ʼ pʉ̀a pie é laa nzèm ńne ńcÿóte. Ńdÿɔ́ʼɔ gẅí púʼu, mélàʼmie pɔ́ lɔ́ɔn těen ḿbɔ́gɔ Ssé wɔ́, ḿbiŋ ńgÿo páʼ á la gwaa gwɔ́, mbà pi pǔ ńkʉ́a, ḿbú ńtsáŋ.
en: They met you along the way and attacked all your stragglers from behind when you were tired and weary. They did not fear God.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gi, ge gÿo gwɔ́ tà pú peʼe megàŋmbù pi ntsèm pie é pú ńkéle gẅí, lélɔg ńnáa sẅétè né pi, á tsɛ̀ɛ wɔɔn ngwòŋ gẅie à náa né pi, páʼ tÿɔgɔ́ légwɔ́ gie pi zyɛ́ʼ ńkú, pi pú ḿbyág pʉ̀a Amalɛg, tà mé le gíŋe ńdáʼ ńkíme wɔ́b ndùmo ssé tsetsáʼ wɔ́: ḿbɔ́ɔn gẅí lélege nò yɔɔn.
en: When the Lord your God gives you rest   from all the enemies around you in the land the Lord your God is giving you to possess as an inheritance,  # 25:19 Dt 15:4 blot out the memory of Amalek under heaven. Do not forget.  # 25:19 Ex 17:8–16; 1Sm 15; 30
